title: Logarithmic Equations - finding a useful form

content.question: ​To solve the equation <math alttext="log subscript 8 open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses plus log subscript 8 open parentheses x plus 4 close parentheses equals 1"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>8</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>8</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, one method is to apply the properties of logarithms to write a new equation that can be used to identify possible solutions. Of the following, which is such an equation?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="fraction numerator x minus 3 over denominator x plus 4 end fraction equals 8"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="x squared plus x minus 12 equals 8"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="x squared plus x minus 12 equals 8"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.13: Exponential and Logarithmic Equations and Inequalities

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
